showScoreExcerpt: "The special effects are sensational, especially if you like theatrical 'black magic'...Plays like a musical - most of the show is underscored and all of the putative song cues are self-evident - and might have been slightly more fun had it been one...To those who have never read a Potter novel or seen a Potter film, 'The Cursed Child' will make no sense at all. Everyone else should find the plot trite, though there's always something cool to see onstage, which helps a bit."

keyPhrases.quote: Everyone else should find the plot trite
there's always something cool to see onstage, which helps a bit

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: The critic finds significant flaws in the plot but appreciates the spectacle and production values, creating a qualified mixed assessment that leans slightly positive due to visual elements. | GPT-4o-mini: The review presents a mixed perspective, highlighting impressive special effects while criticizing the plot, leading to a conditional recommendation.
